product_overview: Base Platform is a web product that enables users to browse and sell cars with associated services. It provides authentication, listings browsing and creation, a services catalog, lead submission, and basic administrative operations in the MVP.
core_goals: Enable visitors to browse car listings and services without authentication.
Allow users to register, login, create listings, and submit leads for cars or services.
Provide admins with the ability to view users and approve listings for quality control.
Ensure seamless client-side routing for smooth user navigation across pages.
Offer a secure and scalable REST API backend supporting all core functionalities.
key_features: Client-side routing to map UI components to routes for intuitive navigation.
Authentication context managing login, registration, and logout actions communicating with the backend.
Frontend pages including Home/Listings, Listing Details, Login/Register, Services, and Admin Users Management.
Backend REST API endpoints for authentication, listings management, services catalog, lead submissions, and admin operations.
Admin interface to view and manage users and approve or reject listings.
Local development environment configured via Docker Compose including PostgreSQL database initialization.
user_flow_summary: Visitor browses listings and views detailed information without authentication.
User registers or logs in to create new car listings and submit leads for listings or services.
User navigates through client-side routed pages: Home/Listings, Listing Details, Services, Login/Register, Admin Users (for admins).
Admin logs in to access the Admin Users page to manage users and approve car listings.
Lead submission flow allows authenticated users to express interest in listings or services through the platform.
validation_criteria: All authentication flows (register, login, logout) must work correctly with API endpoints and update UI accordingly.
Users can successfully browse listings and detailed listing pages without authentication.
Authenticated users can create listings which must be retrievable via listings API.
Services catalog is available and browsable via the frontend and services API.
Leads submitted via the frontend must be successfully received and stored via the leads API.
Admin users can view users list and approve listings, with changes reflected in the UI and backend consistently.
Client-side routing correctly updates URL and renders appropriate pages without full page reloads.
Local development environment starts successfully with all services running including API, frontend, and PostgreSQL database.
